chemical_properties.compound_description: 1,3-diaminopropane is a water-white mobile liquid with an odor of amine. (NTP, 1992) Trimethylenediamine is an alkane-alpha,omega-diamine comprising a propane skeleton with amino substituents at positions 1 and 3. It has a role as a reagent, a human metabolite and a mouse metabolite. It is a conjugate base of a trimethylenediaminium. 1,3-Diaminopropane has been reported in Cyanidium caldarium, Medicago sativa, and other organisms with data available. 1,3-Diaminopropane is a chemical_properties.compound_description: (S)-2-hydroxybutyric acid is an optically active form of 2-hydroxybutyric acid having (S)-configuration. It is a 2-hydroxybutyric acid and a (2S)-2-hydroxy monocarboxylic acid. It is a conjugate acid of a (S)-2-hydroxybutyrate. It is an enantiomer of a (R)-2-hydroxybutyric acid. (S)-2-Hydroxybutyric acid has been reported in Caenorhabditis elegans with data available. 2-Hydroxybutyrate is a hydroxy fatty acid anion and conjugate base of 2-hydroxybutyric acid. 2-Hydroxybutyrate is a metabolite produced by the conversion of cystathionine to cysteine in the glutathione biosynthesis pathway. The amount of 2-hydroxybutyrate secreted in the urine can reflect changes in the rate of glutathione synthesis, which is altered by oxidative stress or toxin exposure. See also: 2-Hydroxybutyric Acid (annotation moved to).(2S)-2-hydroxybutanoic
